UNIT_RSEA_NOMAD
AS2D_SELECT_CARAVEL
AS2D_BIRTH_CARAVEL
-
-
Sea Nomad
-
-Sea Nomads are a collection of ethnic groups that roam the oceans of Maritime Southeast Asia. For generations, Sea Nomads have lived almost entirely on the move in distinct vessels such as the Lepa and Vinta, though there are some settled communities on the coast. In the 15th century, they were recruited as mercenaries by Brunei, and formed a large and significant part of the navy. They often acted like privateers, raiding the coastal settlements and cargo ships of the enemy.
-
Though it is significantly weaker and has less movement than the regular caravel, the Sea Nomad has a much lower production cost. It does however gain doublement along the coastline, which makes it quite cabable of large scale exploration despite reduced default movement. It also gains the prize ships promotion, allowing it to capture enemy ships. By mass producing the Sea Nomad, Brunei can easily overwhelm an enemy fleet through sheer numbers, and then turn that fleet against their former owners!
-
Replaces the Caravel; Much weaker with less movement, but less costly to build. May capture enemy ships and gains double movement on the coast.
